benchmark_details.name: PhysGame
benchmark_details.overview: PhysGame is a pioneering benchmark to evaluate physical commonsense violations in gameplay videos, comprising 880 videos associated with glitches spanning four fundamental domains (i.e., mechanics, kinematics, optics, and material properties) and across 12 distinct categories.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the capability of physical commonsense understanding in video large language models (LLMs) through gameplay videos with physical glitches.

data.source: Gameplay videos crawled from Reddit and YouTube, specifically containing glitches.
data.annotation: Videos are annotated with high-quality multiple-choice questions addressing the nature of glitches.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated based on the correct identification of physical commonsense violations in gameplay videos.
methodology.interpretation: High accuracy indicates the capability of the model to recognize physical commonsense violations.
